\section{What CHAOS Does}

CHAOS is a \textbf{treasury management protocol} that turns cryptocurrency volatility into consistent returns. Instead of passively holding volatile assets (and suffering 60--80\% drawdowns), CHAOS uses a \textbf{formally verified mathematical strategy} to systematically profit from price swings.

\begin{itemize}
  \item The strategy is \textbf{antifragile}: it performs \textit{better} when markets are more volatile
  \item It runs \textbf{autonomously} via smart contracts on Cardano --- no human intervention
  \item All mathematical properties are \textbf{machine-verified} in Lean 4 (a theorem prover)
  \item The strategy is \textbf{asset-agnostic}: tested successfully on ADA, BTC, ETH, SOL, and DOT
\end{itemize}

\textbf{We do not disclose the exact algorithm in this document.} What follows is the evidence that it works.

\noindent\textbf{The one honest failure}: When volatility collapses to near-zero (Volatility Crush), Theorem~1 fails --- \textit{as the theorem predicts}. The strategy requires $\sigma > 25.5\%$ to generate excess returns. This is a feature, not a bug: the math honestly identifies its own limitation.
\endgroup

\vspace{2pt}
\begingroup\small
\noindent Cardano's EUTXO model enables on-chain enforcement of \textit{all} strategy rules without trusted intermediaries. Bitcoin's bare UTXO cannot enforce allocation bounds, oracle consensus, or circuit breakers. The same mathematical strategy that generates +9.3\% on Cardano generates only +0.2\% on Bitcoin L1 --- costs eat the premium.
\endgroup
